result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L. Tibbetts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent, may include sex offense classes 
*Continue with current counseling deemed appropriate by the agent 
*Sign any releases of information 
*No contact with N.M.L.
*Write a letter of apology to N.M.L. within a reasonable time deemed appropriate by the agent and provide to agent for forwarding, if appropriate 
*Register as a sex offender 
*No contact with O.D.K.
*Write a letter of apology to O.D.K. within a reasonable time deemed appropriate by the agent and provide to agent for forwarding, if appropriate 
*Court WILL NOT prohibit the use of computer or smartphone

Defendant Steven L. Tibbetts in court, in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shane Linger appeared for Probabtion and Parole.
1:33 p.m. Court calls the case.  ADA Knaapen states the appearances.
Cases heard today are 14CF142, 14CM179, and 14CF172.
Matter is before the Court for a Probabtion Review Hearing.
ADA Knaapen makes statements regarding the Agent's letter and concurs with the recommendation made by the Agent.
Mr. Tibbetts makes statements to the Court.
Court questons Mr. Tibbetts.
Court reviews the Agent's letter.
Mr. Tibbetts continues making statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant did not put a good faith effort to express apologies to the victims. Defendant has until 03/31/2017 to write acceptable letters. 30 day sanction on case 14CF142 with 14 days credit. Defendant may continue to go to SOT.
from Probation & Parole Agent dated 02/21/17 in re:  Request for Court Review of the defendant's probation supervision

Defendant Steven L. Tibbetts in court with attorney Nila Robinson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-97, 14CF-142, 14CM-179, 14CF-172 and 14CF-124.

2:31 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

This matter is set for a plea hearing. 
There is a plea hearing.

14CF-97 and 14CF-142 and 14CF-172 are being amended.
State files amended informations.

Atty Robinson has received a copy of the amended informations.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim in 14CF-172 is present, would like to make a comment.

14CF-97:
Defendant will plead to Count 1 of amended information
Count 2 would be dismissed and read in
Defense is free to argue

Victim submitted an impact statement in 14CF-97

14CF-142:
Defendant will plead to amended charge

14CF-172:
Defendant will plead to amended charge

14CM-179:
Defendant will plead to charge as charged in complaint

14CF-124:
Dismissed and Read In

Atty Robinson concurs, addresses the Court regarding the jail recommendation of the plea agreement. Atty Robinson does not see a breach of the plea agreement.

Defendant concurs. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF-97:  Count 1: NO CONTEST
14CF-142: NO CONTEST
14CF-172: NO CONTEST
14CM-179: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Robinson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Atty Robinson addresses the Court, faxed some information to the Court this morning. Atty Robinson presents information to the Court at this time, photos and letters, which will be referred to in the course of argument.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-97: Amended Count 1: 4th Degree Sexual Assault
14CF-97: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-142: Amended 4th Degree Sexual Assault
14CF-172: Amended 4th Degree Sexual Assault
14CM-179: 4th Degree Sexual Assault
14CF-124: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are prepared to go to sentencing today.
Court has received from the State the victim impact statement of N.M.L. and letters from others. Court has also received a certificate of completion for partners in parenting program and has received 4 photos. 

2:56 PM O.D.K. addresses the Court.

3:03 PM Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests probation with jail. 
State requests bonds posted to be applied to restitution and fine/costs.
3:13 PM Atty Robinson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests an imposed and stayed sentence, community service and home detention. Atty Robinson requests that physical property seized to be returned.
3:30 PM Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has reviewed the victim impact statement and documents provided by Defense. Court has heard from victim and reviewed complaints in each file. Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-97:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 9 Months
Huber granted for work and counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Court will not grant electronic monitor
Sentence to commence TODAY
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Restitution of $130


14CF-142:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 9 Months is Imposed and Stayed
Consecutive to 14CF-97
Huber granted for work and counseling
Not eligible for electronic monitor
Probation for a period of  3 Years
Conditions:
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent, may include sex offense class
Continue with current counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
Sign any releases of information
No Contact with N.M.L.
Write a letter of apology to N.M.L. within a reasonable time deemed appropriate by the agent and provide to agent for forwarding if appropriate
Register as a sex offender
No Contact with O.D.K
Write a letter of apology to O.D.K. within a reasonable time deemed appropriate by the agent and provide to agent for forwarding if appropriate
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Court will not prohibit the use of computer or smartphone


14CF-172:
Jail sentence of 9 Months, Imposed and Stayed
Concurrent to 14CF-142 but Consecutive to 14CF-97
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Curt will not find Defendant eligible for electronic monitoring
Probation for a period of  36 Months
Concurrent to 14CF-142
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-142
No Contact with A.M.O.
Write a letter of apology to A.M.O. within a reasonable time deemed appropriate by the agent and provide to agent for forwarding if appropriate
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

14CM-179:
Jail sentence of 9 Months, Imposed and Stayed
Consecutive to 14CF-172, 14CF-142 and 14CF-97
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Curt will not find Defendant eligible for electronic monitoring
Probation for a period of  36 Months
Concurrent to  and 14CF-142 and 14CF-172
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-142 and 14CF-172
No Contact with J.R.K
Write a letter of apology to J.R.K. within a reasonable time deemed appropriate by the agent and provide to agent for forwarding if appropriate
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Cash bonds applied to first restitution and then to fines/costs.
Plea hearing at 03-09-2016 02:30 pm
Bond Assignment
Jury trial at 03-10-2016 08:00 am

10:15 a.m. Court request cases 14CF97, 14CF124, 14CF142, 14CF172 and 14CM179.  ADA Knaapen is questioned as to the status of these cases.  BTC: Will schedule for 2 day jury trial for all cases on March 10 & 11, 2016.  Jury trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 11-23-2015 09:45 am

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Nila J. Robinson appeared by phone for Defendant Steven L. Tibbetts. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF97, 14CF124, 14CF142, 14CF172, 14CM179

1:34 p.m.  Court calls the case.   
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.  There is no formal written motion at this time.  Asks for a continuance of the jury trial for the reasons stated.  Needs to speak with each of the victims about the negotiations for resolution of these cases. 
Atty Robinson makes statements to the Court.  
Court questions Atty Knaapen. 
Atty Knaapen responds. 
Atty Robinson makes additional statements to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes additional statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Knaapen further. 

BY THE COURT:  Court has received the request of the State and joined by defense counsel and the defendant.  Court is concerned that there are a number of victims and that these matters are getting old having started in March 2014.  The interest of justice may be reached with an adjournment.  Court removes the jury trials for 11/5 & 11/6 and sets for a pre-trial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:45 am.
